dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening credit sequence plays against : The busy streets of Manhattan. Pizza guys tossing the dough. Cabs pick up passengers. Doormen wave greetings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Central Park's trees blow in the wind. People walk in the park on the tracks. A gang hovers over a bridge, heckling people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commuters still linger in the subway waiting for a train. A tollbooth attendant reads a paperback. A train roars by, the sound of which mixes into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roar of the train can be heard overhead. SIMPSON, an exec of about 45, balding on top wearing a three piece suit, is sitting on a 1890's style park bench. He is out cold. He starts to stir. He lifts his head, it appears as if it is day time. He looks around him. SIMPSON's P.O.V. - The overhead lights are so bright, it simulates a mid day noon sun. There are even Dusk sky colors and clouds painted on the ceiling. SIMPSON is very confused.... He looks around him to see several multi colored buildings and he appears to be on a checkered red and white brick road between two rows of buildings. He sees a miniature castle at the end of the road that is about 1/50th scale of another similar theme park. The whole room is about 600 yards long and it gets small as you go near the castle. There is a Merry Go Round just to the left of castle and there are only four doors on the entire street. One labeled "Movie Theater", the second labeled "The Old West", the third "Fantasy Land" and the last labeled "The Real World". The ceiling is as high as a high school gymnasium. From beside the miniature Castle comes a giant human sized SCRAPS THE DOG. A theme song starts to play over the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheesy, generic announcer voice over the loud speakers) Ladies and gentlemen, the official mascot of Murderland.... Scraps the Dog

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps is a human sized fluffy human in a dog suit. Scraps looks friendly as he waves and moves stiffly like he's animatronic. SIMPSON starts to laugh to himself. Then as the song is playing, Scraps pulls out a Tommy Gun and starts to shoot at Simpson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choose the doorway that starts you on your magical journey into (the voice turns from cheesy to evil) MURDERLAND !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simpson ducks, and glass breaks behind him from a store window. As he hides behind the bench, the Merry Go Round starts on and the horses begin to fire bullets as well. Simpson is forced to go toward the Movie Theater. He goes in, barely missing the bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the action on television monitors. This room is set up like a Newsroom with about twelve T.V. monitors and computer counsels and mixing boards. At the controls in this dark room is BRUCE, late thirties, unshaven and cold as ice. Behind him are JOHNNY, his assistant, mid twenties and semi Italian looking, and lurking in the shadows is ZACH, a corporate ass kiss who wears $600 shoes and wears GQ glasses with his Armani suit. The room is colored with blue light from the monitors and the electronic lights surrounding all the computer consoles. Behind the two seat console is the couch where Zach is sitting. This room is impeccably clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think he'd make it past Scraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just see if he can make it into round two....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny pulls out a bag of chips and starts to eat a handful. Bruce shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chomping on the chips) What ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't eat at the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthful of chips) What ? Are you my mother ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my control board and I don't want it acting squirrelly because you dropped a few crumbs into the keyboard, no put the shit away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir Mom. (puts the chips down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMPSON is panting and stops to catch his breathe. A Black & White silent film is playing on the big screen. The movie playing is showing the making of Murderland. There are only about four or five rows of seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the movie screen) Have a seat Mr. Simpson ! Murderland was created in 1987. Taking the original 82nd street subway station which was abandoned in 1913, our engineers were able to construct all thirty rides in less than......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors all close and lock. Simpson looks panicked. He claws helplessly at the doors. He sits at one of the seats and gets an electrical shock that would kill a small animal. He falls to the floor, when he looks up he sees at one of the doors, the exit light flickers on and off. He goes to it. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the movie screen) ..... all thirty rides and attractions ! Our engineers have built.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE is working the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never underestimate a man who cheats on his taxes. His file says he is an avid jogger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding me ! His lazy ass couldn't win the special Olympics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simpson is limping his way down the hall. There are doors of varying sizes and shapes on either side of him. Some have light emanating from behind them, some don't. It's important to note that there is no other light other than the light coming from behind the doors. Other than that it is pitch black in here. Only the doors present themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speakers) Mr. Simpson, so many doors, so many choices. Which do you prefer ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor and ceiling begin their hydraulic rise/fall toward Simpson. The closing makes a grating, mechanical noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chose wisely and with expediency !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simpson is panicking, there is no easy choice. His brow is covered in sweat and he starts to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny rolls his chair back and slaps his hand to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll never get it right. Try the Log Ride !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, he's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said NO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny gets up and walks to the back of the room. Zach listens intently to the dissention. On the monitor we see Simpson grabbing at a door that's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simpson moves on the the next door. It's locked He moves to the last door on the left side. He opens it. He gets knocked all the way against the other side of the hall by a spike. He is impaled by a four feet long, one foot wide metal spike. Blood drips from his corpse on the opposite wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the hydraulics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returns to his console, pressing several buttons on the keyboard) Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor we see the floor stop rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (polishing his glasses) Is that it ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd say that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a phone pole sticking in his chest, I think we don't need an autopsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just looking for our best interests. May I have the tapes, Bruce ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE removes a VHS tape from the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds the tape as Zach tries to take it) Doesn't it bother you to see this kind of brutal death ? I mean , I can understand the old man's infatuation with the stuff, but not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an investment banker. I see blood bathes everyday. Besides, mine is not to question why, min is but to do or die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one has a gun to your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unamused, Bruce let's go of the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might I suggest going a little easier on them ? It will prolong the end and our benefactor will be more pleased if we could elongate the inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce just stares at him in contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny, let's get the cleanup started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got it boss. One more mangled body to the East River, coming up !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must be going. Gentlemen....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach leaves and Johnny escorts him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow ZACH as he walks down a street and enters an office complex for ...... Establishing Shot : FIRST BANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING SHOT: Zach enters wearing the usual plush Armani and his GQ glasses. He nods to security as he goes into the elevator. This is a multi billion dollar bank he works at. The lobby has plush marble floors and the expensive furniture that goes with being in the 9th largest commercial bank worldwide. There are all dark, expensive suits, all almost oblivious of each other walking to and from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach exits the elevator. He must go to the other end of the building to take the elevator to the penthouse. He sees SAUNDRA, a mid twenties brunette who is wearing a very mini skirt. She is all business, but definitely has sexuality oozing from her pores. She is standing at the water cooler with another exec named JUDY, 38 and a little heavy set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So have you seen Simpson ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, why ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He missed a meeting this morning. Simpson hasn't missed a meeting in three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he had a better offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter much. There's such an incredible turnover here... (sees Zach approaching from elevator) Be careful, major kiss ass approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach approaches and Judy exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see what the First Bank stock opened at ? Very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually it's down .2 from the last quarters highest, but I think it will pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am equally impressed with your knowledge of the market. How long have you been with the company now ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four years. I came over from the Capitol merger in Chicago six months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you involved in the incident where that guy killed himself in his office ? (her silence answers the question) I am sorry. Perhaps we should have dinner tonight to.... discuss your future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra is not blind to the innuendo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps not. I have to work on the PRD merger tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enter MATTHEW, a temp in his early twenties and an incredible smart ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good golly miss molly you are looking good today !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAUNDRA is mildly amused with Matthew and this is a tension causer for Zach. Zach has no tolerance for anything not work related.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look at this tie. You could fry an egg off that orange, yow. Have you ever considered the Jerry Garcia line of ties ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, gentlemen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAUNDRA leaves, giggling at the tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might I remind you Mr. Parker, that you are a temporary employee and I hope you have no aspirations of becoming permanent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach exits toward his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you sir, have you ever considered Mydol for that attitude. It takes the edge off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a big money bank, so the furnishings are extravagant. The giant oak wood table is in the center of this room and a giant glass window facing the park can be seen. Saundra is at the table with about twenty other N.D. executives. They are watching the latest internal video from CEO JOHN C. McCAY. On the video we see a nice little creek and pasture setting and wearing jeans & a sweater McCay sitting near a wooden fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm John C. McCay. I am proud to have the new PRD team join the family. We all know that we grow everyday. Together we can make First Bank work for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video ends with McCay giving the camera a thumbs up and the graphics saying "First Bank Works For You !". Fred Thomison, 45, stands up and turns the monitor off. He turns to the waiting executives

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over SPEAKER PHONE) Fire the whole division.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still over speaker phone) Fire the whole division. We're moving more of the operations division into Manhattan anyway. Whoever is left over from the conversion is no longer needed. We already have all the key people here. Anyone else is expendable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I came from the Chicago offices myself, and if I may say, sir, there are still some very good....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the speaker phone & more than a little irritated) If you want, I can fire you and have someone else who has the balls terminate these worthless people. Which will it be ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will start work on it now sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a rude, unacknowledged click from the speaker phone, then dial tone. Thomison turns the line off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone know where to start ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes turn to Zach in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start with the top and work our way down. We start with the high salaries and then just let the little people go. No need to make the blue collars go crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I disagree. I think we should start looking into the severance pay schedules and make sure the people with families can.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Miss. I know you're still upset about that incident in Chicago, but understand, this is a cut throat business. We don't have time to play nursemaid to every single Tom Dick and Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should make the time. Especially considering the sixteen million dollars we have set aside expressly to settle law suits from these very events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole room sits still for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (democratically) Let's put it to a vote. All those in favor of cutting loose without the proper relations to our old co workers ? Put your hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only Zach raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That about covers it then. Now the next order of business will be.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This goes way beyond posh here. There are exotic paintings (originals) and lots of open spaces. Elephant tusks and other hunter type trophies. This is definitely a man's office from a man who suffers from penis envy. He has all the high brow, multi millionaire furnishings in dark wood and an outside fountain and arboretum. This room is at least three thousand square feet. ZACH enters with his briefcase in hand. From outside enters, John C. McCay, president of First Bank. He's in his mid to late fifties and all gray hair and a little portly. He wears glasses and presents himself as having power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zachory ! My boy, how goes the carnage down on 44 ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that well sir. I believe we have a few too many soft hearts in the building. Did we aquire a bank from Chicago or a charity ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, son. They'll learn in time that you don't fuck with First Bank. This is the real deal and we aim to keep it strong. My Daddy always told me that Only The Strong Survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that was Darwin, sir. Or perhaps Nietzsche ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it was. I was in boarding school for so many years, it's hard to remember. Do you have the tape of the latest exploits from my favorite hobby ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, I do. Last night's, fresh from the Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to say, that I am glad you are such an amazing kiss ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you , sir. Sir, may I ask you a question ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I am not morally against these little, shall we say "hobbies", as long as I am on the payroll, but why not something like a yacht club ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach, how old are you, son ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am thirty two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how much do we pay you annually ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I make roughly four hundred thousand a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach my boy, I can spend your yearly salary in a blink. I have had that kind of money all of my life. If I wanted to, I could fly to Paris for the afternoon. (starts to pace) My father formed this company over seventy years ago. When my brother became mentally challenged, it was put in my charge. Now running a bank of this size is very stressful. I need to relax on what little down time I have. A yacht club will not quite make my blood pressure decline. Understand ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have entrusted you with a great many things. In your tenure with this company you have seen and heard things that could upset the very economic world in which we live. I think this kind of loyalty should be rewarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John C. McCay reaches into his desk and hands Zach a pen set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. I was really hoping for shares, or possibly cash... but this, this is really personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, let's watch the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John C. McCay and Zach sit on a couch in a soundproof room in the penthouse office suite. The big screen T.V. replays the demise of SIMPSON. Zach watches as stoically as he did the previous night. John C. McCay watches like a pervert watching a porno. He is excited. As the tape ends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was rather.... disappointing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had suggested that they tone down the program so that the "guests" might take longer to expire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want more action. I want to see more ingenuity than that. I want to see the injured man out wit the machines !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir, most of the people we are putting into the "Park" are accountants that embezzle or investment bankers. They are not known for their physical or intellectual prowess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe Ol' Bruce is having as much fun with this as he once did. He still insists on the "guests" being of the more nefarious type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, sir. He does a thorough background check and if he finds them to be criminal or guilty of embezzlement, then he will put them in the park. He has refused the last three suggested "guests".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that time when the mail room kid was accused of stealing and we put him in the "Park" ? Wasn't that a computer glitch ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. It turns out we put an innocent man into the "park" and he was not the one who stole from the stamp machine. That is also about the time when Bruce began refusing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That mail room kid was the longest lasting "guest" yet ! Maybe we can alter the computer records and make another "guest" from the more athletic of our staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce may still refuse. It is my belief that he is becoming more belligerent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CEO contemplates this for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I propose we consider a hostile take over. Perhaps Ol' Bruce is in need of a new job opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean sir ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we were to put Bruce into the Park as a Guest ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet that would be the Park run of the century !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, he created the Park. He would know how to circumvent any of the traps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm willing to bet that even the creator can't out wit his creation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What then sir ? What would we do with the park with out Bruce ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think the assistant, what's his name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, do you think he would like a raise and a new position ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, this is not like firing any employee. We can't predict what will happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That my boy, is the best part. Life on top of the world is boring... predictable. If I wanted life without chances, I never would have paid for Murderland. Now go. Make a formal proposal and see about the assistant. Find out if it's viable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach begins to go into the elevator. After he's gone. McCay opens up a video library named after former employees who have entered Murderland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach walks out of the elevator again. He sees MATTHEW flirting with Saundra. Although his face won't betray it, Zach is very jealous of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I'm serious. Look at Wilma. She's this frail little thing, and Fred, I mean Fred Flintstone is this BIG guy. He has to be hung like a horse, and THAT's why Wilma puts up with his B.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never heard the Flintstones reduced to a sexual exploitation quite like that. You're funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach is right on the other side of the cubicles from them. He can hear clearly, but they don't know he's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I was thinking, you know. Would you go, it's I think you're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go out with me ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sounds so much better when you say it. I'm semi traditional here, and it's important that I ask. Will you go out with me ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really ? On a date ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is too easy, I mean I had a speech prepared, then I even wore these pants because I could get on my knees to grovel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As appealing as that sounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner at my place then ? Say, seven o'clock ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra leaves. From the next cube leans over JEFF,24 and a little unshaven and wearing a loud suit and tie. Jeff is equally free of any real responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe she said yes !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Normally I'd have to spend weeks laying down the leg work to land a beautiful baby like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so lucky that Zach didn't get there first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Mr. Bad Ties ? I wasn't worried about him. He's one of those guys who has a wardrobe but no personality. Saundra doesn't want that. She wants someone who can MAKE her laugh. Not someone she can laugh AT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both crack up at this and ZACH walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce & Johnny are repairing the Merry Go Round of horses that fire bullets. There are tools and parts lying about. Bruce is wearing only a tank top and is using a wrench on the large piece of the motor. Johnny looks very bored and is twirling a 9 millimeter pistol like a cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand me the 3/8ths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Am I ever going to get to run the controls for one these capers ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I think you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will that be ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you are ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you're going to have to start trusting me sometime. I am a trustworthy person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust is earned not given away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESPECT is earned not given away, trust is given away to anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not down here. I'll start trusting you when I feel there the time is right. It's not personal, it's just survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been working with you for four years, don't you think that's worthy of at least one turn at the controls ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny gets up and walks around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made my bones on the street, you know. I did Riglioni in his own house. I was made in the Family, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who bailed you out when a hit was put on you, you sorry sack of shit. Who put you up ? Who gave you a job ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Now who needs to trust who ? Trust me, when you're ready to work the controls, I'll put you in the hot seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny stands for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think that maybe I am.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce just sighs out loud and then turns a switch and the Merry Go Round horses begin to fire right towards JOHHNY. They hit right at his feet. He dances a little jig around the bullets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ ! Stop Stop Stop !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop, and Bruce is laughing hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asshole ! They could have missed !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a small bar in an alley in Manhattan. It looks as though no one has entered it in decades. It's run down and dusty. The lights are off. Zach enters through the front door. He sits at the bar. JOHNNY comes in from the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. Executive. Buy you a drink sailor ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have new "guests" for the park. I have a file on them. May I see Bruce ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been expecting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points the way to the broom closet. They go in and the back of the closet opens up into an elevator. Both of them enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This elevator is like the service elevators at the back of a hotel that only the janitors see, only smaller. It can barely fit these two. Zach curiously looks at Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a fucking problem ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I was just curious if what I heard about you is true ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you hear ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only that you were one of the finest hit men in the mob. That if you wanted a good clean kill, that Johnny Tortelli was the man for the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might I ask why you no longer work for the mob ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a bit of confusion on one of my last jobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought, and correct me if I'm wrong, but weren't you trying to play both sides ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for ? A blow job ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I am not a homosexual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do you want ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever considered running your own "Park" ? I mean, since you will not be returning to your former profession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think even this company could afford to write off enough to build a new "Park".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach pauses, he hits the stop button on the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you happy with your salary and position ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I am not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had hoped you would say that. I have a proposal for you.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is firing away at the paper targets.  Zach and Johnny enter from the elevator. Johnny takes up a place next to him. This is a two man firing range about 100 yards long in a small rectangular room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. What do you have today ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an embezzler and his accomplice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach opens his briefcase and hands over a file in a manilla folder. Bruce takes it and opens it up. We see MATTHEWS face on a B&W photo, and the next picture is of SAUNDRA from he security badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This young man is a temporary in our accounting department and he has managed to steal a large sum of money through the wire transfer system. He is sleeping with one of our account executives to gain passwords. We believe she is in on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce contemplates this. Johnny fires off several shots. He gets a lot better accuracy than Bruce does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do the standard research and have them in by midnight, pending any unforseen problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Nice to see you, Bruce. Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is concerned. He logs into the company computer and begins to check files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to double check the facts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computer blips up a screen of accounts and personnel files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see here that this guy has made deposits into his own account for the last four months. Each one in the amount of $100,000. He then puts in deposits into his girlfriends account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He already had a balance of $600,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He probably has a history of this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe.... Let's start the background checks. Let's see where they live and what kind of security systems....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew lives on the Upper West Side, kinda posh for a temp don't you think ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any priors ? Any police record ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking..... Hah ! He has a shit load of unpaid parking tickets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parking tickets ? That's it ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but we're talking 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real criminal.... I still think that's our in... What about her ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking........

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew is running around his apartment, throwing clothes into a closet and hiding stuff under the couch. Matthew lives in a decent apartment with black leather sofa and matching chair, exactly what a bachelor would have. The Felix the Cat clock reads 6:59 PM The doorbell rings. Matthew runs to the door, and whacks his knee on the corner of the table. (very Peter Sellers style). He gets to the door, trying not to cringe in pain. He opens the door. It's Saundra, looking absolutely beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying very hard to be suave) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I brought some wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, won't you come in ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as she enters & he's behind her, he winces in pain from his knee. She walks across the room toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an incredible view !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He limps horribly & painfully toward her. She spins around and he goes upright pretending to be smooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew is prepping food in the kitchen while Saundra is at the table. He brings out the main course, it's chicken . He tries to be smooth and cut it, but jabs his finger instead. He winces, but tries (remember TRIES) to remain cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Excuse me for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a real nice place... how can you afford this working as a temp ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew is jumping up & down in pain while she looks around the room again. She turns toward him and he straightens up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I make good investments, I lead a double life as a secret agent.. I....I ... I have very rich parents. I have always had a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they're so rich, why are you working at all ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to have something that's mine, you know ? It's like living off of their money is fun and all. There are certain materialistic needs that I have that can only be satisfied with that extra little scratch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what, a Porsche ? A Ferrari ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would that impress you ? I mean you're the kinda woman that probably has Ferrari written all over your personal ad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm more interested in the man behind the wheel more than the manufacturer. So what is it that you have that makes you a materialistic fool ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My own sit down Star Wars arcade game. Wanna play it ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sits in the corner of the room. We hear the familiar voice in the game say "The Force Will Be With You.... Always".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Bruce & Johnny dressed as policemen, they knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra is playing the arcade game. Matthew is right beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now go under go under it ! Shoot Vader's Tie Fighter ! Get Him Get Him !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yahoo !!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew gets up and goes to the door. He is staring down Bruce & Johnny in their police uniforms. This will play almost like an episode of COPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Matthew Parker ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, can I help you ? Maybe a donut or something ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very funny, sir. You are under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey , Hey !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny moves in behind him & begins to cuff him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have 43 unpaid parking tickets, sir. You have the right to remain silent, anything you say can & will be held.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't be alarmed, Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kojak here is arresting me for unpaid parking tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 unpaid parking tickets, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have anything better to do ? There a rapists & murders out there and you came out here to arrest him for parking tickets ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny steps behind her. He places chloroform over her mouth. She struggles. She manages to elbow Johnny in the gut & he goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce kicks Matthew in the gut & he goes down. Saundra tries to get past Bruce, but he overpowers her. He puts his chloroform over her mouth and she tries to hit him, but to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is carrying Saundra in over his shoulder. He places her on the floor next to where Johnny throws MATTHEW. Bruce is now wearing his normal black attire and a dark, thin trench coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter how many times I wear one of those fucking uniforms, I'll never get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny looks at his boss in a devious way. Johnny preps a syringe behind his back without looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That about does it. I'll take them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is leaning down over Saundra, checking her face. Johnny leans in and injects Bruce with a syringe in the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nighty night, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny is turning on all the monitors and turning various knobs and controls. Zach is typing into his laptop. Johnny sits down in Bruce's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who are these people with the Boss ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a temp who pissed me off and a girl who turned me down for the night of her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you the bitter one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bright as day lights are fading in. Bruce starts to stir on the ground. He starts to get on his knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny has his back turned to the monitors, checking on a few system checks. Zach is there, observing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing Bruce trying to stand) How long till the drug wears off ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have another fifteen minutes at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce has just awaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ?????

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny turns around in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is struggling to stand. His hand is on his head. Beside him is Matthew and Saundra. Saundra begins to stir as the sound system booms a voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very loud over the P.A.) Welcome to Murderland ! Where death is a fun experience for one and all !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Saundra) Get up. Get up !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time. Get him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce starts to move toward the Movie theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny is furiously pressing buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra leans over to Matthew and tries to shake him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, we're in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew is groggier than the other two were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... did we uhm, you know....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ! Just get up. This is serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew looks around. He is more than surprised at the similarities to a certain Theme park in Orlando, FL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did we get to Disn....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feedback permeates from the sound system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from P.A.) Try not to fight too hard, boss !!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From beside the miniature castle comes Scraps the Dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's ....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps begins to fire his tommy gun. Matthew and Saundra get by the hail of bullets to the door near the Movie Theater. Then the Merry Go Round begins to fire. They get forced in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you this would be easy. Just like a maestro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is already inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you ! What the hell is going on ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell kind of cop are you ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce ignores them. The B&W movie begins playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Movie Screen) Murderland was created in 1987. Taking the original 82nd street subway station which was abandoned in 1913, our engineers were able to construct all thirty rides in less than......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce runs straight to a seat in the third row. He reaches underneath and pulls out a 9mm pistol. He checks the clip, then locks and loads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny tries to speedily zoom in on Bruce to see what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is Bruce doing ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce gets up and methodically shoots the two video camera's in the corners of the room. Matthew screams, Saundra just plugs her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitors for that room go dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must have had a gun stashed. God damn it !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't afford too many surprises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll never make it out of the park alive. I promise you that....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew feels dizzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta sit down, I have a headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO. Don't. You'll get a shock from hell if you touch that seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you anyway ? What the hell is this ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is trying to pry the door with the flickering exit light to open. It comes open a moment later. He runs into the Hall of Doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should follow him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need to sit and think for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bruce walks slowly and cautiously in, Saundra walks behind him several paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Off Camera) OUCH !!! GODDAMMIT that hurts !!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to himself) I told him not to sit down in there.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew limps in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, fine, I feel like a chicken McNugget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door locks shut and the lights dim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Voice Over from P.A.) Well, boss you've already surprised me. I'll try not to let it happen again. Where to kids ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ceiling begins to lower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof is coming down.... hey, you.... Which door gets us out of here ??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one, this door is locked !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO ! Don't open ANY of them ! They're all wrong. Just wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for what ? i don't wanna alarm you but we'll be the special at the International House of Pancakes in about five minutes !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, if you open any door, you'll be dead a whole lot sooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should we trust you ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made this place..... now listen to me. I'll get out of this room, we have bigger troubles than this....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will he make it out ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, this one's a gimme. Just be patient, even Ol' Bruce can't outwit some of these traps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The distance is closing fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, NOW I'm worried. What exactly is on the other side of the door ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either you'll be shot with bullets, impaled with a large spike, or nailed like a super model. Basically you're fucked any way you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavy on the sarcasm) And that's different than this because...... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the floor gets nearer to the ceiling, Bruce opens the air vent on the ceiling. He crawls in. Matthew stares in disbelief and Saundra moves right after Bruce into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, maybe you know the answer to this, but I'm still the trivia champion at BW3's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew jumps into the vent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is like an air conditioning vent, only a little large to accommodate human guests on their hands and knees or kneeling. The light comes from the floor vent ahead. Bruce crawls through and kicks in the vent to the next room. He jumps down. Saundra looks ahead of her and jumps down herself. Matthew, a little hurt from the Foosball thing pokes his head down into the next room. Then he falls through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we have here is a human sized Foosball playing field. There is astro turf on the ground, bright soccer field lines and giant metal poles each one with either four, three or two "players". The "players" are giant six foot tall versions of their three inch counter parts. They are lightly padded, but with enough force, they could be lethal. A five foot tall, white inflatable ball is already in play on the field. The ball could knock the wind out of you, but not fatally. Bruce is waiting next to a hole that leads into the field. Saundra and Matthew drop down from the vent to see him waiting, gun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from P.A.) Come on boss man ! Don't you wanna play ?  You've never beaten me on the table up in the bar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall beside them starts to close in, forcing them into the playing field. Bruce waits for a moment.. then starts to run through the field. Saundra goes next, then Matthew follows. Once on the field, Matthew realizes what he's in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in comedic shock) You've got to be kidding me !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, Matthew is swiped by one of the cushioned, human sized Foosball players. He gets the wind knocked out of him. Further ahead, Bruce ducks and dodges the players with some ease, but gets hit unexpectedly by the five foot tall ball. He looses his balance and goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor, we get a bird's eye view of the whole field, as if it were a video game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way ! Look at her go !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor, we see Saundra, bob and weave her way through to near the end without getting hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra makes it to the end and waits by the exit. Bruce gets up, only to get knocked over by a player. Bruce gets up again and sees the ball rolling right to him. He pulls out the pistol and shoots the ball and the air decompresses. He then makes his way to the exit. He starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Matt ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him, he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra runs back out to the field. She makes her way to Matthew. He's trying to stand but gets knocked over every time by a player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny is playing the game controls laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra gets to Matthew and helps him up. Together they run to the exit. They duck together and weave together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny hits the controls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck ! That's not fair ! She cheated !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra makes it to the exit with Matthew in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey buddy, thanks for the help back there !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't help criminals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce goes through the door that now opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criminals ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's next ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a turn for the worse for the team !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do believe Mr. McCray will be most pleased with the tape of this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a maze of poles, like the ones used for directing people to a ride at a real amusement park. There are warped pictures of the other rides & Scraps the Dog painted on the walls. The ceiling is fairly low in this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mr. Personality ! Stop for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce keeps on walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking to you asshole !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe all that testosterone plugs his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew starts to giggle at his own joke, only to find BRUCE dead in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me one good reason why I don't plug you right here, right now ? (Bruce hold the gun to Matthew's nose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of my charming personality ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce cocks the hammer back. Saundra pushes the gun up and gets in BRUCE's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell us what the fuck is going on ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said we were criminals, what did you mean ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're both embezzling. I saw the records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embezzling ? I'm not embezzling !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not, but he is and fucking him makes you an accessory. He stole your passwords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not fucking him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whining a little) You don't have to sound so emphatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just having our first date when you showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce keeps on walking through the lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd hurry it up, love birds. You don't want to see what happens when you don't keep the lines moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he says this, spikes come out of the poles and the back of the line begins to close in. The whole room is closing in on them - there is no backtracking here. Saundra frustrated, moves ahead. Matthew sees the spikes closing in slowly and spares no time catching up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them come into the start of the ride. There is a log ride boat awaiting them in the small tunnel of water. It leads to the left and there is an obvious drop right away. The room has a Bayou motif complete with fake wooden sheds and boat houses. The light is green and simulates a Louisiana mystic evening. The sign reads "Keep your hands and feet in at all times or else the 'Gator's will bite them off ! Enjoy the Demon Water Ride !" Matthew stops for a second to ponder the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you built this place ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer, just Bruce waiting for the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you have WAY too much free time on your hands. What about other hobbies ? I mean what's wrong with building toy trains or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Boat arrives. The walls start to push in, forcing everyone into the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny speaks into a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor we see them all get on board the little log shaped boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In starts off slow. And there's the canned screams from rides from the 1920's. They immediately drop at a 40 degree angle and splash into a little water. The lighting gets dimmer as they go. Matthew gets most of the splashes and is drenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wipes the water out of his eyes) Awk ! This sucks !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat moves slowly to the left, then jerks slightly to the right. Up ahead, we see a small hill leading up. Bruce begins to tighten his grip on the bar. Saundra notices, and also grabs tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the boat starts down a slop, while missing th up hill ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Oh Shit !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ride begins several sharp turns and steep drops. Saundra is terrified, Matthew is feeling nauseous. Bruce is smiling slightly. He's proud of his work. After a about three minutes of turns and drops, and even sudden lifts. They reach the bottom. It's darker here than the rest of the ride. The boat stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it over ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is quiet and still for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from P.A.) That's it folks for the Demon Boat Ride.... Everybody off. Watch your hands and feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the dock ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat starts to sink in the black water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh SHIT !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is first out & he's swimming away from the one light in this pool. It's emanating from the far wall, underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where are you going ? Hey !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew & Saundra are following him as he swims to a rock in the middle of this seemingly black sea. Bruce gets on the rock and stands. Matthew stops and treads water, trying to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. (spits water out) I think I lost my wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd get out of the water if I were you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over P.A.) And now ladies and gentlemen it's time for the fabulous CROCODILE SHOW !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great ! You couldn't be a fan of Dolphins or some other less threatening animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra gets on the rock with Bruce. Matthew is lagging. He gets to the rock just as the underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underwater lights come on. It illuminates the whole cave where they are. The bluish green pool is about 300 square feet and branches off in four directions. It's like someone made their pool into a fake swamp. Matthew panics when he sees that there are about twelve crocks in the water with him. He gets up on the rock too. They are crowding this little rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Who can make it to the exit alive ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny presses a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rock begins its descent into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got five bucks that says someone dies here and now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see that bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach reaches into his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rock completely lowers into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now where do we go ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you made this place ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did, but this room has four exits and only one opens, it's up to them in the control room. There's one right over there. The exit light is on, but he can change it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to swim for it. The light turns off and another light on the other side of the cave turns on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck ! He's toying with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce looks from side to side. Saundra tries to see a way out too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit here comes a crock ! Here it comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce sees this and moves closer to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny leans to the edge of his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready to hand over that fiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crock is moving in on Saundra. Bruce pulls out the pistol and fires it into the water and empties it into the crock. He sees the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crocks will eat him up before they come after us, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all three start to swim for the exit that's open. The crocodiles all go after the dead crock and start to feast. The blood keeps them from even noticing anything else in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach reaches out his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were saying ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny hands over a dirty five dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to switch exits on him again ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why ? The crocks are all going for the dead crock. There's no fun in it. Besides we've got plenty more for them. The night is young....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is dripping and Saundra is shaking for the first time yet. Matthew has been shaken since he woke up and is finding new levels of scared. This tunnel is about four feet wide and simulates a real cave. The walls are brown and gray with moss in certain spots. There are pink and blue lights to give this a fairy tale look. Fake smoke comes from tiny spouts in the floor. We here faint growls from something ominous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's next Walt ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened ? Did you have a real bad theme park experience as a kid and this is your revenge ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stops at a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Be very, very quiet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Are you hunting wabbits ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pan around the three and the camera peeks around the corner to reveal a ..... Giant animatronic Dragon. It is about thirty feet long, green with scales all the way down it's long tail. It has wings in the back and it's head is down low like it is sleeping. Smoke comes out of it's nostrils as it groans. The eyes slowly open and close and the head barely lifts off the ground. The pink and blue lights shine on it's green skin to give it a surreal look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) The room has sound sensors. If you wake it up, it breathes fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) You were one of those guys that played Dungeons & Dragons with real swords, weren't you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce makes his way across the room silently. Matthew tries to go next. He stops and stares at the dragon. He then keeps moving. Saundra goes last. From the side of the wall, a trip wire extends out. She trips and falls. The dragons head rises. The roar is horrible. From the mouth starts to breath fire like a flamethrower. Bruce rushes back and pulls Saundra up forcefully. The heat is immense. They all three make it around the corner to a set of stairs. Bruce rushes them all up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming over the burning sounds) Keep moving, keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire fills the last three or four steps. It catches Bruce on the foot. He winces, but keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach hands over the five dollar bill back to Johnny

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a hallway that physically gets smaller, it's a perspective warp with black and white swirls painted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we get out of this room ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wait. This is an elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elevator ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're about a hundred an fifty feet below the subway stations. We're heading a little higher up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bruce) How's your foot ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating her) "How's your foot" ? This guy tried to kill us and he put us in this place, and you want to know how his foot is ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell us a little about yourself ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look pipsqueak, I'm having a real bad day here and we're just starting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door the came in from opens up and they exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The come into room that is about a hundred yards by a hundred yards and over a sixty feet tall. It's dimly lit, but there are millions of small red, blue, and yellow plastic balls covering the floor. At the far end of the room is a jungle gym maze of padded walls that lead up to an exit at the top of the room. Basically this is like an adult version of a McDonald's Playland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what the hell are we supposed to do ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to climb up that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not to tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce points to the sea of plastic balls. As he does, eight feet tall Nerf spikes fly out of the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's enough force to push you twenty feet in the air. It won't kill you, but it will hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have issues. I mean you have some serious issues that need to be ironed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Issues ??? This guy has the damn subscription to every psychotic issue I've ever heard of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cute asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see if the lovely contestant can make it to the top in three minutes !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soundtrack starts to play over the loud speaker a la American Gladiators. Bruce starts to run into the sea of plastic balls. The "running" ends pretty quick. The balls are about five feet deep. Matthew and Saundra dive in as well.  They struggle to move in the plastic ball mess. A few of the Nerf torpedoes launch around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is moving along. Matthew starts to try a swimming motion. He starts to really move fast along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, try swimming. It works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swimming, you know, like in water, moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra starts to do a swimming motion and moves along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a fucking.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is cut off by a Nerf projectile that launches him a few feet into the air. He lands just ahead of Matthew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The struggle through and get to the tower. Matthew gets to the deck first & helps Saundra up. They both help pull Bruce out of the Plastic Ball Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to climb up these slides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start up a slide and move forward. They get to another level up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have about sixty seconds !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of a studio audience screams out in joy (prerecorded of course)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry ! Hurry !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They find a rope with knots in it. They start to climb it. One at a time. Then more speedily they go into the nest level and find they have one more to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we get up to the top ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce just stares for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ? Don't you remember ? You know everything else but this ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Studio Audience track is counting down from TEN SECONDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember ! Here, here !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs around the outside of the play set & goes around to the top. Saundra follows, then Matthew. Just as the countdown gets to one, they get into the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wait by the door to the next room, until it opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a perfect mock up of a current day subway station in New York. Matthew is looking at the sign that says MEN'S ROOM rather longingly. Saundra is scoping the room out. BRUCE is staring forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This probably isn't the bet time, but I really have to pee. Can I pee ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock yourself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts for the Men's Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Bruce yells for him, Matthew is shut into the Men's room and the subway train arrives. The smoke and air rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do now ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from P.A.) Why don't you get in ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor starts to retract. Bruce gets in & Saundra reluctantly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew is staring around. The urinals are putrid. The stalls emit an odor that keeps him from crossing the room. He hold his nose. On the speakers, a muzak version of Presidents of the United States song "Lump" starts to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from P.A.) Welcome to the Men's Room !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little self conscious here. I can't urinate if you're gonna be watching from the video camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The toilets begin to flush automatically. The brown colored water starts to fill the floor. The room tips slightly toward them. Matthew starts to slide a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from P.A.) Maybe you should get over fears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from P.A.) Well, Mr. Parker it seems that your is not the wardrobe of choice tonight. I'm quite confident that my tie is looking better than yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, realizing who's voice it is) You son of a bitch ! I knew this wasn't about my parking tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from P.A.) That water there is piped in from the great toilets of the upper class. I hope you brought a snorkel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ceiling begins to lower. Matthew stares longingly at the door. It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce holds on to the rail as this thing corners harshly. Saundra keeps losing her grip on the rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where does this lead ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No where. We've got about seven minutes before this thing slams into a concrete wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you anyway ? What is this place ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called Murderland. It's paid for by First Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First Bank ? But how ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a tax write off for John C. McCay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCay knows ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knows ? He watches every "Guest" on tape. This whole place is here for his sick amusement. And no so are we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights flicker out as they round another corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ceiling is closing, and so is the nasty brown water from the toilets. Matthew is staring in the mirror of the broken, dirty mirror. He has given up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it ! get over your fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands next to a urinal. He unzips his fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, this is bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look he figured it out !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone) I can see your small business ! Look at it it's so small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew is trying to pee. His eyes are closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that this might seem like the right time to come out of the closet, but believe me, it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny is laughing and pointing at Zach who is fuming and turning red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on monitor) Unless of course the guy your with is your lover. By all means let it out. Start sharing the gay love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny stops laughing. He slams down on a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room tilts even more with a sudden jolt. Matthew looks up surprised ! He's Peeing !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ! yes Yes Yes !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as he's finished, a door opens up on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cardinal rule, lovebirds, once you start peeing you can't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew flushes and runs out the open door that opened in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce has his eyes closed. Saundra jumps up. She goes to the door and breaks the glass with her elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps out. Bruce smiles at this. He follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny looks at his monitors. He was so busy with Matthew he didn't notice them jump. On the moniter, we see the empty subway hit the concrete wall at full speed, smashing itself to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look ! Look !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, I forgot about them. Well, I guess the boss man wasn't as tough as I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe we should watch the tape to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're paying the bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra is walking (limping may be more accurate) back towards the station (fake station anyway). Bruce is trailing behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey ! Hey ! I'm talking to you !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took an awful big risk back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look I don't even wanna know how I got in this mess. I just want out. It has nothing to do with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hadn't started boffing that weasel with an attitude, you wouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'M NOT BOFFING MATTHEW !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you didn't give him any passwords of any kind ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO ! I wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he isn't embezzling either is he ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he ? His parents are rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts walking again. Bruce contemplates this. He vaguely remember the bank statements, but they did show that he had a lot of money before the wire transfers began, long before he started work at the bank. Bruce runs back over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew walks into a room that has several tubes of varying shapes, colors, & sizes, yet all are big enough for a person to climb into and crawl through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the speakers) So many tubes to get in, only one is the way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.. great. Is there any kind of hint or anything ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, and over speakers) Pick with expediency !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls close in on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't rush me or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew frantically sizes up the ten or twelve tubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue IS my color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew climbs into the blue tube and crawls through it. As he crawls through it, the tube begins to shake a little, then spins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
