dialogues.text: Well isn't this fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to move a lot faster. Then it begins to tip downward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhhhh SHHHHHHITTT !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew slides right into a fluffy pillow about ten feet long. Matthew looks around the small room. He puts his arm on the back of his neck and starts to rub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am definitely going to see a chiropractor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door slides like Star Trek open before him. A giant spotlight shines on Matthew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the new room) Okay drivers ! Start your engines !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew slowly rises and looks into the race track room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember not to touch the floor or else... (a giant buzzer sound) You'll get the shock of your life !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew gets into a smaller size race car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra is still walking ahead of Bruce. He is still limping & trying to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're telling me you were set up ? I knew something was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very sarcastic) I'm not listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey ! I'm still your best chance to get out of here alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been doing a bang up job so far. Right now Matt is probably dead and it's your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny & Zach are reviewing the tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Mr. Parker doing ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the live feed monitor we see Matthew driving a miniature bumper car around a maze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's driving. He can't step off or he'll be electrocuted and I haven't open the maze up yet. He can't get out. A cell phone rings. Johnny turns and looks around. Zach removes the phone from his jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Zachary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from phone) Zach, my boy ! How is tonights adventure going ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John C. McCay is in a robe and drinking wine from a nice glass. There is a beautiful woman in a MAID's outfit in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Is it as good as I hope it is ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from phone) Better, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maid approaches Mr. McCay and starts to kiss his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Maid) One moment dear... (she goes down O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from phone) Sir ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Not you Zach. (to Maid) Remember, my wife is asleep upstairs, dear. (back into phone) Zach, am I gonna like what I see on this tape ? Is it the grandest of all the Park's tapes ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach is loosening his tie. Johnny is yawning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes sir. It will be the best of your collection, I assure you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from phone) Fantastic ! A little faster sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir ? We're moving them right along as fast as we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from phone) Have that tape on my desk tomorrow morning. (sounds of a groan) First.... thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Try a little aspirin for that. The phone clicks off. Zach starts to fold up his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that the Old Man ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I think he's feeling sick or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny starts to use the controls to zoom on Matthew in the race car. On the moniter we see Matthew looking very serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew is driving like a race car driver. he's even making th engine noises himself. The car is made for a twelve year old, so Matthew's knees are up against his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the moniter we see Saundra break out the door window and jump out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There ! There ! Did you see ! They're still alive !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that but where ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra is still defiantly walking ahead of Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't take them that long to figure out we weren't on the train when it wrecked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not listening !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there's another train. They'll send it through here. You're fucked if you don't STOP and listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the subway station, we can get into a power duct that my little shit head of an assistant doesn't know about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny is working the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I've got the other train coming around now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stops. He hears the other train coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, it's too late. The other train's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can hear the horn of the train from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any ideas ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens up before them in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He found us already. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce casually walks into the room. Saundra walks in, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Thought you had me there didn't you Bruce ! Just goes to show that the tail can wag the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In what looks like just a storeroom, Bruce tries for the door. It's locked. Then the water starts to pour in from ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the trick here ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously, but what's the way out ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once the room depletes it's oxygen, we have about 30 seconds, then a door opens on the bottom over there. Then we swim out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long till the room fills ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say about thirty to forty minutes. Give or take a few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce goes over to the camera and pulls it off by hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moniter goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a real complex about being on camera, doesn't he ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is just looking around. They're both bored. There's nothing to do but wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why this ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you build this whole place ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this really the time ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have something better to talk about ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a long moment) I just graduated from M.I.T. in engineering. That's when John McCay hired me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hired you to build this place ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hired in and started to do the boring old work routine. I was originally brought in as a technical advisor. First Bank had sponsored my scholarships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashback scene. Bruce is younger, clean shaven and in a suit. He has his own office & on his desk is the old game MOUSETRAP, modified and works by itself. John C. McCay enters. McCay talks to Bruce with a smile on his face & motions for them to leave together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was asked to design something for Mr. McCay. I had no idea what it was. I though it was going to be a real amusement park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a door that has remained shut for many decades, Bruce & John C McCay enter the dark room with a late 1800's or early 1900's feel to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I first saw the abandoned subway tunnel, I still had no idea what it was he wanted done. I started work on the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is toiling away with the unfinished Main Street Merry Go Round. There are a lot of construction workers hammering and putting up walls. The walls are starting to go up on all of the buildings and it is a preliminary version of Main Street. There is even an unfinished, unpainted castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is when I found out the truth....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John McCay arrives with Zach. Bruce shakes hands with Zach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wanted a few changes in the design.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Merry Go Round begins to emit gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is when they told what it was really for. They said that the people that would be sent down here would only be criminals, the scum of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The younger Bruce is at the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember the first guest. He was an accountant that had raped his daughter. He went to trial with the best lawyers and got off. McCay used this as an opportunity. We nabbed him and put him in Murderland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the moniter we see a middle aged exec wake up and get gunned down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how I got started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce has his head down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was lured by all the money and I truly did convince myself that what I did was for justice. Since then, McCay has wanted to put anyone he can down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how do you know if the people are guilty ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do a very thorough background check. I go through police files, personel files, anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how come Matt and I showed up as guilty ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was there, clear as day. I saw the computer records. Matthew has been fed wiring money to his personal account. (beat) I just knew something was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you may have been duped this whole time. Killing innocent people, that must make you feel ..., how does it feel ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are other things too. They had everyone start taking those psych tests. Did they make you take one ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, everyone has to when they get hired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more to it than trying to see if you'd steal from the company or if you'd lie or cheat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCay had a lot money done into researching psychological reactions to questions that are seemingly unrelated, but reveal everything. Like criminal impulses, homicidal impulses.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is at the knees and rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you believe that ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've since changed my mind. I designed this place, based on my belief that I was doing what the legal system couldn't or wouldn't do. McCay had the company buy the property and they pay the bills. It's a tax write off. On the books everything looks kosher. I have an office on 5th that I haven't seen in ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't anyone notice all the people missing ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is New York. No one notices anyone. Not even when someone disappears. At first it was the guy who was caught trying to steal McCay's Jag. Then it was dirty accountants that tried to walk away with millions. The Old Man got such a rush from it, I thought that he would start trying to send me people who used the copier after hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you just take a life ? I mean it's a life, life is so precious.  How does it feel ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do with the company, if I might ask ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in charge of the conversions. (beat) When First Bank buys another smaller bank, I'm in charge of converting them to our systems and way of doing things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when you took those jobs away last October from the Mid West Central, and that guy killed himself, how did it make you feel ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce starts to circle her. The water is to their waists now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very surprised that he knows) I... I .....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't think about it did you ? I read your file. It said you had a nervous breakdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to let his family know....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what ? That it was your fault ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't my fault. I was just part of a team. I was doing my job...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So was I. So don't give me any shit. Your business is just as bad. At least I'm up front about it. You kill people slowly. Your corporate take overs can decimate a families livelihood over a year sometimes two. Now you know how it feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra just turns away and faces the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny is finishing off a bag of chips, pouring them straight into his mouth from the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is repugnant. You have the habits of a goat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ach ! How will you know if they've made it ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room will fill to the top, then if they wind up in the next room, they lived, if not, they're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is up to their neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember, hold your breath as long as you can. Then go right over to that corner. The door will open and go in and up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is going over their heads now. Bruce takes a deep breath and goes under. Saundra holds out till the last possible second. These thirty seconds are the longest of their lives. The pressure on their lungs is enormous. Just when the panic begins to set in, the door opens. Bruce pushes Saundra through then follows through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra rises to the surface and gasps for air. Bruce comes up and does the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit they made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands over another five dollar bill to Zach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Goddamn it Bruce, you've cost me about thirty dollars so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce looks up at the video camera. It's too high up to hit. He scorns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the P/A) Why don't you just stop fucking around and just die !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick of playing. I've got a better idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce walks under the camera. He motions for Saundra to follow. He opens a panel off of the wall. In there is a small service tunnel. Inside is a shotgun and two pistols. He hands her a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the moniter we see Bruce re-enter the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I lost you there for a second boss man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the moniter we see Bruce raise the shotgun and aim it directly at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny drops the bag of chips. On the moniter we see the screen go blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we can get to through the next room, we'll be at a junction for a power grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the room that has a 1/100th scale of Manhattan Island. It's night and storming. There are little robotic cars that honk horns and even little voices of cab drivers cursing at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, real cute. The storm is fake, but the lightening is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Mr Inventor, how do we avoid it ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't. It's random, there no trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to move through the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I have five that says THIS is it for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll see hat action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce move fast in between the buildings. Saundra follows behind. Lightening is striking at 7 or 8 second bursts throughout. The voices of the cabs and cars is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brooklyn Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run in between the buildings. A Bolt hits right between them. There is even fake thunder sounds. The keep trucking forward. Bruce trips on a car and hits the ground. Saundra tugs at his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Up ! Keep coming. Come On !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce gets up and goes. They are holding hands as they push onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that touching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Isn't that cute !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the moniter we see a bolt hit right on Bruce. Saundra loses her grip on his hand. He goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra goes back for Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, get up ! You can make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce starts to stir. It wasn't a direct hit, but more than a small shock. His arm is steaming from the singe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, just stop yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He groggily gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me my five back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and Saundra make it to the Brooklyn Bridge. They go into the half height exit door that's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach is holding onto his five dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's next ? No one's ever made it this far before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got two chices.either it's the Bowling Alley from Hell or Alice in Murderland. See this ? Even Bruce knows that no one can make it out of here in one piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fingers a moniter. There is a map that has the entire maze listed on the screen next to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being the fair guy that he is, Bruce designed this place so that there is one solution to every room. If you can make it through all thirty rooms, you live. No one's made it past seven till now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew is still driving like a madman. He looks very sleepy. Another automated car bumps into him from behind, giving him a jolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over P.A.) You must come in first place to move on !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, my legs are asleep. I'll never be able to win this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More of the other miniature cars race past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have played more Nintendo racing games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He floors it and gets into the race again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a room with astro turf for grass and three giant fake trees. There's a long dining table set up with plates and desert. This room looks like movie set and the paper machete decorations on the wall add to it. Bruce & Saundra enter. There is a murmuring of deep voices. The lights brighten on the trees. They begin to come to life & speak. The Trees have faces & the speak like the Trees from the Wizard of Oz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey buddy, you got a light ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't smoke asshole, you'll catch fire !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awe, let him smoke, what I need is a little piece of ass !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra laughs at the arguement that the trees are having. Bruce starts to walk toward the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do ? Leaf fuck him ? You've got no genitalia ! You Are A Tree ! Get it ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just stop that or I'll......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point a gas is emitted from the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God ! That smells downright rank !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yikes, I shouldn't have had that taco !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other tree let's loose a yellow gas from the leaves. Saundra begins to cough and gasp. Bruce does to, then he runs over to the dinner table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick, drink this !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a cup of tea from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's poison gas, this is the antidote. Drink it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys disgust me !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hee hee hee hee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pull my branch !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hee hee hee hee heeh hee/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra drinks the tea & then Bruce takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stops Saundra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Help me get the panel off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tear at the wall piece and it comes off. Bruce sees the power box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce pulls out the Shotgun and fires it. All the lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over half the monitors go out. The grid of the entire Murderland has over half go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The power went out in half the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can this happen ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I think that a power grid just needs reset. Don't get your panties in a bunch. I'll go down and reset it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go in there ? What if Bruce finds you ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. He's stuck all the way over here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny points on the map of the park on a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll never make it to the main power grid. Those two are way over here... (points to another area) I'll be over here trying to get the power back up. It'll only take a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny gets a flashlight and a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew is sitting in his miniature bumper car in the dark. None of the other cars are moving and only the emergency lights are on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey ! Hey ! What happened ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws his helmut on the floor. Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No guts no glory. Of course without any guts, I'd have a hard time keeping my food down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out and touches the floor real fast. He flinches. Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electrocuted my ass !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to walk around the race track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and Saundra are running through the now powerless hall in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where you're going ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a thud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (painfully) Girder, watch your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a door open. Then a flashlight illuminates the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, we can take this service tunnel straight to the end. No one knows about this but me. It'll lead you out to Central Park, and I'll take care of my #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go into the long service tunnel. It's about 100 feet ahead and looks like just a brick tunnel where workmen would walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew gets over to the wall where a barely visible door is. With the partition, he never would have been able to make it to this part if the floor was still electrifying. Matthew boldly opens the door and peeks in. The door slams right back at him. He jumps in a panic. There is a hallway with emergency lights on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now Mr. Helper, I like the look of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes in. There are two tunnels. He takes the one on the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the ceiling, a hatch opens, Johnny looks around. The power is barely on. Only the emergency lights are on. He climbs down. This is an all wooden simulated Sheriff's office circa 1865. Johnny sees something out the window (he's on the second floor).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew walks into the enormous room that appears to be a small section of an Old West Town. There is a Saloon, a General Store, a Stable, and at the far end to his right is the Sheriff's Station. The lights are coming from the light fixtures in the ceiling. This area still has full power. The ceiling is about sixty feet up and simulates high noon. There is even a wind machine blowing dust and tumble weeds back and forth across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) What the hell will he think of next ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew stands at the center of the town and sees the stable at he end of the right side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew walks in cautiously and sees an animatronic horse. Matthew sees a water fountain and takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the wall of a building opens the secret passage. Out comes Bruce and Saundra. They are quiet as can be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny checks the clip in his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the gun) Let's kill us some weasel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny exits through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew starts to stare at the fake, unmoving horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a mock cowboy voice) Steady ! Steady !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny turns around when he hears the voice. He cocks his pistol and starts to move quickly and silently to the stable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First Saundra & Bruce turn at the voice, then Johnny walks right by them. Bruce takes out his shotgun and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny gets to the door to the stable. He very slowly raises his pistol. From JOHNNY's POV we see, He takes his time aiming at Matthew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock Mister Ed voice) Wilbur, I have an itch on my ass, can you scratch it ? Wi wi wi wi Wilbur !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce sees Johnny about to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not polite to stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. of Johnny's eyes going wide. SUPER DUPER FAST - Johnny swings and goes low, shooting off the pistol at Bruce. Bruce fires off a round from the shot gun. They both miss each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew drops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (petting the leg of the horse) I'm sorry Mr. Ed ! I'm sorry Mr. Ed !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A showdown is in progress. Johnny is behind a water trough firing his pistol at Bruce. Bruce is behind a beam post of a building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's you get the gun Boss man ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is silent. He starts to reload.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that you said we were at the START of trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny fires off several rounds at Bruce. Johnny then ducks into the saloon. Bruce follows, firing at him as he goes. The shotgun is empty. He drops it in the road and enters the saloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew pops his head out into the street. No one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce enters. No one there. This place has a piano, a bar, and the chandeliers and about twelve tables and matching chairs, all following the 1965 motif. From behind the bar, Johnny pops up and starts to fire - two handed John Woo style with a nine millimeter and a .45. Bruce goes to the ground and rolls over, firing from a pistol. Glass bottles and the mirror behind Johnny shatter, He goes back down behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew walks wearily by. Saundra gets behind him from the alley. She taps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ ! I'm just a temp for Christ sakes !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up ! It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm very quickly getting over my phobia of public urination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shots can easily be heard going off int he Saloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a stalemate so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up Bruce. You can work the park better, but I'm the better shot. You know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce thinks for a second. He knows it's true. Then he gets an idea. he starts to crawl away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you take some of this ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny gets up and starts firing away at the floor where Bruce WAS. He's so busy firing he doesn't notice. He finishes up and sees an empty floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahem....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is standing next to him with a gun to Johnny's temple. Johnny just closes his eyes in disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn your head a little more to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny turns away from Bruce. Then Johnny slaps the gun from him, and kicks him in the crotch. Johnny then bolts out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny runs past Matthew and Saundra in terror. He goes around the building into the alley and through one of the passages. Bruce comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it over ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scrunchy with pain) Almost. Look, you two get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the jail cell is a spiral staircase. It leads to the surface. Take it all the way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one more person here for me to visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that asshole Zach isn't it ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach from work ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the liaison for McCay. Listen go. Go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't have to tell me twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew starts running to the Sheriff's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stop it. End it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll end. It'll end with him and McCay. Then the park shuts down. Permanently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The both go to the Sheriff's office. Bruce follows Johnny's trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach sees nothing going on and decides to investigate. Zach climbs down the ladder into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he climbs down the ladder ..... Matthew and Saundra see Zach first. They stop completely. Zach gets all the way to the bottom before he sees them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clears her throat) AHEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach turns and sees them. Saundra picks up a piece of wood from the wreckage of the Saloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might I suggest we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kick your ass ? Don't mind if I do (gets ready to punch him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra belts him with the wood and Matthew punches him fiercely. Zach manages to get up and run into one of the halls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny is cowering next to a tree. It is very, very dark in here. It's not at all clear where we are. Suddenly, the lights flicker back to life. Like a tape being slowly turned back on, the sound effects of the room are that of a jungle and helicopters. The lights come back full on to reveal a fake Jungle set. There is a constant loop of Robert Duvall from "Apocolypse Now" screaming "I just love the smell of Napalm in the morning !" Explosions begin to be set off randomly in every direction. Johnny starts to run and Bruce appears before him in the fake creek in the center of the room. Johnny stops dead still. After a moment of sizing each other up, Johnny pulls out a knife menacingly. Bruce reveals a knife from his boot. Then he calmly and slowly approaches Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to bitch slap the boss. (attempts a stab) Come on, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce just steps up and slices into Johnny's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muther fucker !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach limps into what appears to be an office in disarray. He sees the lights flickering on and off. It's hard to say that this intentional or not. As he passes a fax machine, it shoots out little white tubes (just like the old cylinders that fax paper used to be wrapped on). He trips and falls. His glasses fly off of his head. Matthew comes in behind him. So does Saundra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fitting. The Offices of the Damned. This is as good as any place for you to die, you pond sucking piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach backs away from the ratty looking pair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. from P.A.) Uh, Oh ! It's the Boss !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the voice is heard, Saundra pushes Matthew to the floor. From the big dark office behind Zach comes an animatronic John C. McCay (very realistic looking Ala Hall of Presidents) on wheels, holding a machine gun. Zach turns in time to see it as it sprays him full of bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (animatronic pre recorded voice, with no lips moving) You're fired ! You're fired ! You're fired !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The animatronic John C. McCay recedes back into the office on it's rollers. Saundra remains on the floor looking at Matthew, who checks his own body for holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay ? Any holes ? I mean aside from the one's that nature gave you ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both get up and look at the bloody lifeless corpse of Zach on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another bad tie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both walk out of the room back to the Old West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce has Johnny in a head lock and is choking him to death. Johnny gets a hand loose and slams it backwards into Bruce's gut. Johnny is now loose and hits Bruce in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still a little raspy voiced from the choke) You think I'm that easy, Bitch ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) For once in your life, shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce lands a punch in Johnny's face, disorienting him. It's all he needs. A series of deadly blows to the head and stomach. Johnny goes down face first into the creek. Bruce then takes out his knife and slams it into the back of Johnny's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had known this is what it took to shut you up, I'd have done it a year ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew is in the jail cell. He finds the spiral staircase and starts up. Bruce goes to the open access tunnel that Johnny left open. Saundra starts up the spiral stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Matty, don't wait for me or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking maybe we should try this dinner thing again, but maybe the Epcot version will be open by then....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A manhole opens and put comes Matthew & Saundra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus I never dreamed I'd be glad to see Central Park at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long beat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking in every direction) What now ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go to sleep for about a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, idiot. Where do we go now ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks around too) Where are we ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they both turn to see where they are, a group of about six gang members all surround Matthew & Saundra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose any of you know how to get to Park West from here ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang leader, because of his Afro, let's call him KAREEM, 22 and very mean looking African American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm and serene) Wallets. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong answer. (brandishes a gun) I think you better become less fiscally challenged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) It never rains, but it pours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) What the fuck did you just say, whitey !?! Are you commenting on my Afro, muther fucker ? I am sick and tired of lining the Man's wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick it to the Man is what I always say. (everyone stops and stares at Matthew) No, I was just saying what a shitty night we're having. It was nothing to do with your hair style or your (Kareem puts the gun in MMatthewsmouth) mmmmmm hmmmm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's much better. Now wallets. Ya'll white folks think you can talk shit to me and I gotsta take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I should have done that hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to see Bruce holding a shotgun in his right hand and a pistol in the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't none of your bidness, man. You're distracting us from a financial transaction

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, is this distracting ? (moves in closer to two of the thugs) What about this ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce whacks two of the guys in a blink, then fires off at the remainder as they go running back into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's much better. Just us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kareem keeps the gun on Matthew. He is disturbed and panicking on the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say you take the gun out of his mouth and then put it on the ground ? Then I'll let you limp away from this experience. Kareem sizes this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOWLY !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kareem VERY slowly puts the gun on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now turn around. Hands on your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kareem complies. Bruce then slams the but of the shotgun into the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot. I always wanted to know what it was like to see my life flash before my eyes for the one hundredth time tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bruce) Come to the rescue again I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's roll. We have about three quarter of a mile to the edge of the park. They'll be coming back full force and one shotgun is not gonna scare off all of them. It'll be daylight soon too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to trot to the path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew and Saundra get to the street and both stop in exhaustion. They almost fall to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the real man's workout tonight didn't I ? (looks around) Where did he go ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra spins around too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was right behind me !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that guy anyway ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business as usual. People come and go. Corporate America at it's finest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John C McCay enters from the private elevator. He goes by the video viewing room. The T.V. is on. He walks by, then backs up. He goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the tape of last nights adventures in the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach, my boy ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the images from the prior night. He sees Bruce and the others running through the Foosball Field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my this is better than we thought it would be. I told you Ol' Bruce would be the man if we put him in there !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is there in the Police uniform. He punches John C. McCay in the back of the head and then injects him with a syringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fade in. John C McCay hears the sound of the theme music over the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Murderland ! And Here's Scraps the official mascot for Murderland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps takes his shots from the tommy gun. John C. McCay runs his old fat ass toward the entrance that says "FANTASY LAND". He barely dodges the bullets as he makes it into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is like a cartoon, a cartoon living room where all the objects are ten times bigger than they should be. The walls are about 100 feet straight up and there is blue/white wall paper up, also of enormous size. The floor is like giant carpet with a blue shag and even an Afghan on the blue, 30 foot tall couch. In front of the couch is a twenty foot tall coffee table. McCay runs forward towards the other side of the room, the mouse hole is the exit. A Giant vacuum cleaner begins to chase him. He ducks around a leg of the table. The vacuum continues on past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the best you can do, Bruce ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Bruce's silhouette in front of the moniter. His hand works the controls silently. We can see McCay on the monitors and a diagram of the room on another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the moniter) Did you think I didn't learn anything from watching ALL those tapes ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John C McCay is laughing a little and his breath is labored. He sees the vacuum at the other side of the enormous room turning back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even I can out run this thing. He starts to walk a little away from under the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant IRON falls from on top of the huge table. As McCay takes another step he gets crushed by the giant clothing utensil. The vacuum circles the table legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saundra is at the water cooler, getting a drink. Matthew walks up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey good lookin' ! What'cha got cookin' ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey buddy. You okay ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I am. I feel the testosterone coursing through my veins. (pause) Now that I've gotten the stitches removed from my arm and the chiropractor fixed my back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses down on the water button and nothing happens. He hits it and hurts his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow. Son of a ..... (does a "I'm in pain dance") Did I ever tell you my theory on Star Wars as Porn ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think if you take several lines out of context, Star Wars becomes a very sexual movie. I mean listen to this. (mocks ther characters) "Luke, at that speed will you be able to pull out in time ?" or "You came in that thing ? You're braver than I thought".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An executive in a $1,000 three piece suit walks up and smoothly gets the cup full of water. He then turns to face Saundra, and has his back to Matthew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, son. You're not discussing a sexual topic on company time here are you ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew does not recognize or see him at all. As far as he's concerned, he thinks it's another exec. Saundra doesn't notice who it is at first, but does a double take and her jaw goes to the floor as she sees that it is Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very nervous and not recognizing Bruce) No sir. I was just getting , well you know. Water. We weren't talking about sex or anything else except Star Wars. Just saying hello. I think I'm gonna go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you shut up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go ahead and go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew backs away and starts to go back to his cube. Matthew trips over a trash can. After a beat, Matthew straightens up and attempts to salvage the microbe of dignity he has. Another beat and he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you DOING here ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work here, remember ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was eleven years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, surprise, surprise, I've been on the payroll for several years now. I still have an office and secretary. No one even batted an eyelash. Do you realize what the high turnover is in a multi corporation bank in New York ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently pretty high, we just got a new CEO last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah a real shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll see you at the next staff party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce walks into a crowd of people wishing a happy birthday to a co worker. Bruce shakes her hand then moves around the corner. Saundra watches him go and just stares. Then she turns and goes back to work herself.
